criteria: Understanding the concept of a fraction as division.
Applying fraction-as-division understanding to solve problems.
Accuracy and precision in calculations and explanations.
descriptions: Student does not demonstrate an understanding of fractions as division.
Student can partially identify fractions but struggles to connect them to division.
Student can identify fractions and shows a basic understanding of their relationship to division, but with significant errors or gaps.
Student can accurately interpret fractions as division in simple cases, with some minor errors or need for assistance.
Student consistently and accurately interprets fractions as division, demonstrating a solid understanding.
Student demonstrates a deep understanding of fractions as division and can explain the concept clearly and accurately, even in complex scenarios.
Student is unable to apply the concept to solve any problems.
Student attempts to apply the concept but is unsuccessful in solving problems.
Student can apply the concept to solve very simple problems, but struggles with more complex ones.
Student can solve problems of moderate complexity using the concept, but may make some errors.
Student can solve a variety of problems accurately and efficiently using the concept.
Student can solve complex problems accurately and efficiently, and can explain their reasoning clearly and logically.
Work is completely inaccurate with no correct steps.
Work contains significant errors and lacks clear explanations.
Work contains some errors, but the student attempts to explain their reasoning.
Work is mostly accurate with clear explanations, but may contain minor errors.
Work is accurate and precise with clear and logical explanations.
Work is exceptionally accurate, precise, and well-explained, demonstrating a deep understanding of the concepts.
